name: winter wheat stitch™ flat mittens
sizes_available: baby (toddler, child) (teen/adult small, adult, adult large)
notes:
discover the joy of making your own cozy mittens with the **winter wheat stitch™ flat mittens** crochet pattern! perfect for all skill levels, this clever design is worked *completely flat* with just *one simple seam*—no tricky shaping required. featuring the beautifully textured wheat stitch™, these mittens are as stylish as they are warm. with sizes ranging from baby to adult large, you can create a pair for everyone in the family. plus, they’re quick to whip up, making them perfect for last-minute gifts or satisfying weekend projects. 

crochet hook:
[g (4.0mm) or g+/7 (4.5mm) - or size to meet gauge][1]

notions:
[removable stitch marker][2]
[yarn needle to weave in ends][3]
[scissors][4]

yarn:

[lion brand color theory][5]
100% acrylic, 246yds/100g
g+/7 (4.5mm) hook used with this yarn

or 

[herrschners worsted 8 heathers yar][6]n
100% acrylic, 489yds/226g
g (4.0mm) hook used with this yarn

yardage:
60 (100, 175) (210, 250, 270) yds
1 (1, 1) (1, 2, 2) skeins color theory
1 skein herrschners heathers

yarn substitutions:

[wecrochet brava tweed][7]
97% premium acrylic, 3% viscose, 218yds/100g

[wecrochet brava worsted][8]
100% premium acrylic, 218yds/100g

[wecrochet mighty stitch][9]
80% acrylic/20% superwash wool, 208yds/100g

[lion brand pound of love][10]
100% acrylic, 1020yds/16oz

[mary maxim maximum value yarn][11]
100% acrylic, 474yds/8oz

abbreviations
blo - back loop only
ch(s) - chain(s)
rs - right side
sc - single crochet
sc2tog -single crochet two together
sl st - slip stitch
st(s) - stitch(es)
ws - wrong side

gauge:
17 sts and 14 rows = 4" by 4" in rows 3-6 of pattern stitch

not sure what gauge is? [check out this blog post: what is crochet gauge and how to fix it][12]

sizes:
baby (toddler, child) (teen/adult small, adult, adult large)

skill level:
advanced beginner
